title: Hispanic and Latino Americans
summary: Hispanic and Latino Americans (Spanish: Estadounidenses hispanos y latinoamericanos; Portuguese: Estadunidenses hisp√¢nicos e latino-americanos) are Americans of Spanish or Latin American ancestry.[3][5][6][7] More broadly, these demographics include all Americans who identify as Hispanic or Latino regardless of ancestry.[8][9][10][11][12] As of 2020, the Census Bureau estimated that there were almost 62.1 million Hispanics and Latinos living in the United States (18.7% of the overall population).[1]
